title.narrative: F.a: Ecumenical Accompaniment Programme in Palestine and Israel (EAPPI)

description.narrative: Monitoring and deterring human rights violations through to support civilians living under military occupation, advocating for the end of the occupation and for a peaceful solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict in accordance of international humanita rian law.The main objective:Offering protective presence to vulnerable communities, sustained monitoring and documentation of the human rights situation in the target areas. Awareness-raising and mobilising people in Finland to actively support peace in IO PT. Expected results:? A decrease in the number of violent acts and harassment towards the people accompanied, particularly in areas close to settlements, checkpoint, schools and agricultural gates.? A strengthened advocacy for civilian protection and poli cy change, affirming the respect and application of human rights and international humanitarian law, and UN Security Council resolutions.Through public information sharing and advocacy work, EAPPI raises awareness and actions to stop violations of HR and I HL and counteract impunity.Right-holders/ beneficiaries:1. Palestinian communities suffering from military occupation, settler violence, restrictions of movement and the separation wall,2. Palestinian and Israeli human rights defenders and peace activists who face harassment, violence, imprisonment and obstacles of their work.3. Implementing partner:World Council of Churches (WCC)
